intro: Microstylis lata, commonly known as the broad-leafed microstylis, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. Microstylis lata typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation.
